alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of Lawrence and southwestern Wayne Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Job, or 7 miles north of Inez, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Louisa, Yatesville Lake State Park, Fort Gay, Ulysses, Charley, Centerville, Dunlow, Gallup, Clifford, Glenhayes, Buchanan, Fallsburg and Genoa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
